title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 14:42  
vmassol - (14:42): XWIKI-5364  
vmassol - (14:44): anyone knows how hard or easy to fix it is? sdumitriu? cjdelisle?  
sdumitriu - (14:44): Fairly easy  
vmassol - (14:45): thibaut from XWiki SAS says he needs it fixed for a customer  
vmassol - (14:45): so we need to find someone willing to work on it  
vmassol - (14:45): any taker? :)  
sdumitriu - (14:45): I can take it later today  
vmassol - (14:46): that would be cool thanks  
lucaa left at 14:54 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
sdumitriu - (14:56): Hm, just realized I forgot to send the release announcement mail  
sburjan - (14:56): yes, he reported this to me .. 1 month ago .. even before you visited Romania  
sburjan - (14:56): sdumitriu, : yes, i forgot to tell you :)  
sburjan - (14:59): vmassol,  : Se2 final will be out only next year .. I just talked to the guys .. and one of them is moving to Mozilla as QA. And they have a ton of features to implements. So migration to SE2 will take longer than we (at least I) expected  
vmassol - (15:00): Se2?  
vmassol - (15:00): selenium  
vmassol - (15:00): we already use it  
vmassol - (15:00): :)  
sburjan - (15:01): I know. But we use an alpha version  
sburjan - (15:01): I was was asking them when will be final .. and they said .. next year .. not this one  
vmassol - (15:03): ok  
vmassol - (15:03): thanks for the infp  
vmassol - (15:03): info  
sburjan - (15:04): they said they have a huge feature set waiting to be implemented .. and I see commits daily (they have a similar bot)  
sburjan - (15:12): can someone tell ne what is the difference between a normal import and a static import ?  
vmassol - (15:17): http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/guide/language/static-import.html ?  
sburjan - (15:18): I want to fail() a selenium test  
sburjan - (15:18): and I am only allowed to do this if I import with static  
sburjan - (15:20): thnaks  
sburjan - (15:20): \*thanks  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:23  
sburjan - (15:33): anyone has any idea which is the best way to wait for a livetable to refresh ? (within UI-tests)  
sburjan - (15:34): I can't see another way besides wait some time  
vmassol - (15:36): nope  
vmassol - (15:36): we do support this  
vmassol - (15:36): check the livetable page element  
vmassol - (15:36): (sburjan)  
sburjan - (15:37): thanks  
vmassol - (15:37): LiveTableElement.java  
sburjan - (15:37): found it :)  
sdumitriu - (15:38): \setlength{\evensidemargin}{0in}  
sdumitriu - (15:38): Sorry, wrong window  
sburjan - (15:49): vmassol, : i think one method from LiveTableElement is broken  
sburjan - (15:50): the hasColumn() I think i breaks  
sburjan - (15:52): \*it  
bblfish left at 15:52 (Quit: Leaving.
